Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir

After considerable travel inconveniences due to the great lack of horses in these parts, I arrived on the 4th of this month at this district of Vacaria, having the satisfaction, however, of finding everything in peace, as well as favorable news from São Paulo, for which reason it seems to me for the moment unnecessary for Lieutenant-Colonel Rodrigo to march, and sufficient the company of Captain José Antônio de Oliveira, who marched with me and whom I leave in position over the Antas, at Passo de Cima, in this district, until my return from Lages to which I am proceeding today, where I could obtain some horses in very poor condition, to march slowly; and from there, with better information, I will inform Your Excellency about Cima da Serra, how this place is in the most lamentable state possible, both in horses and cattle, which are only found in few parts.
